top_categories.workout_context: Race-pace efforts that mimic Sea Otter Classic Gravel's demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before April.
Sea Otter Classic Gravel's Fort Ord fire roads, Coastal gravel forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 89 miles.
8,100ft of climbing means repeated surges above threshold. VO2max work is how you survive the fifth climb, not just the first.
91ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At mile 60 of 89, glycogen is gone. This workout teaches your body to produce watts on fumes.
At Sea Otter Classic Gravel, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Sea Otter Classic Gravel, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Sea Otter Classic Gravel. Train it until it feels boring.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on former military base fire roads and coastal gravel. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
8,100ft of climbing on grades that change every minute. You need to switch from seated to standing without losing rhythm.
Endurance with intensity spikes baked in. Exactly what 8,100ft of climbing on former military base fire roads and coastal gravel does to your power file on race day.
Two threshold sessions per week without the recovery cost of VO2max work. For 89 miles, sustainable FTP gains matter more than peak power.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Sea Otter Classic Gravel’s 89 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Sea Otter Classic Gravel requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on former military base fire roads and coastal gravel to build confidence. Expect: fort ord fire roads, coastal gravel, military base terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and VO2max to prepare you for 89 miles of former military base fire roads and coastal gravel in Monterey, California.
